INFO.NAME: Kanien’kéha Glossary
INFO.INTRO: Kanien’kéha Glossary.  We update this more often than most content in this website - based on what students request.

ENTRY.DEFINITION:
Do you speak?               Sarónkha ken?

Let’s speak Mohawk.     Kanienkéha tewatati.

Mary said                       Wa’i:ron ne Wá:ri

Monica said                   Wa:i:ron ne Wanik

My grandmother said     Wa’i:ron ne Akhsó’tha

His father said                Wahèn:ron ne ro’níha
Sa’nikonraién:tas ken?   - Do you understand?
iah

hen

hen'en

Tekononhwerá:ton  - I greet one of you.

Tekeninonhwerá:tons  - I greet 2 of you.

Tekwanonhwerá:tons  - I greet all of you / We thank you very much / honor you / welcome you / give you thanks . (more than 3)

Tekonhwerá:tons - I am greeting you

Tekhenonhwerá:tons - I welcome her.

Wa’tkhenonwerá:ton  - I welcome her / someone / them

Wa’tekhenonhwerá:ton  - I give her greetings / thanks / honor / welcome

i:i oni wahkwanonweron  - I greet all of you

Watkononwera:ton  - I greeted you

Wakwahonkaron  - We invite you

Teiethinonhwera:tons  - We greet them

i:i oni wak'kwanonweron 

She:kon sewakwekon  -  Hi everyone.

Niá:wen, wakatshennon:ni tsi wakatatia’thewe - thanks, Im happy to be here.

Wa’tkonnonhwerá:ton tsi wáhsewe nakonhwentsàke  - welcome to my world
Kanien’kéha   - Mohawk Language

I am a Mohawk person  - Kanien'kehà:ka na'tia'tò:ten

Kanien'kehá:ka - People of the flint

Tehatirihó:ken - In council, they are named because Tekarihó:ken was seen by some as a great Kanien’kéha when the confederacy was formed.
keriseron:ni  -  I am knitting socks.

Onkwehonwè:ke/Onkwehonwè:ne - Place of the Native people

 

A'nó:wara tsi kawè:note - Turtle island

 

A'nowarà:ke - On the turtle
A’nowere:ke
Iethinisténha Ohwentsiate  earth.mp3
kawennontáhkon     the language that was used.
saia'tanó:ron  - You are precious
aktsikhé:ta   -  my honey, sweetie

Oh ni:ioht ahsiron ne <english word / phrase here>?   - What is Kanien’kéha way to say < english word > ?

 

Oh naho:ten kenton ne <kanien’kéha word here>?   What does this word mean <kanien’kéha>?

Tenenha   - seed game

Atenénha  - seeds game

Kayentowá:nen   - peach stone game

Ate'shennayentha  - pin & stick game. Child’s game where bone awl has string of animal vertabraes tied together. Try and toss the vertebrae and catch onto point of the awl.  Breakdown of this phrase:

  • wakate’shén:nayen - I have an opportunity
  • tha - thing used for
  • wak = it to me
  • ate = reflexive in
  • ’shenn - opportunity
  • yen - have put down
Wakskaré:wake  - I am Wolf clan.
tsawenhsa’kó:wa
skanekwen'tará:non

karí:se

Kén:reks aotáhson

Teiotina'karontòn:'a aotáhson
teiotokerón:te

Iakohehseráhstha

Óhrhes

kanenratiron  -  holding up the troop / group.

raotitiohkwa - their group / their band of people

raotikióhkwa  - their group

okiókwa - band of people

otióhkwa - band of people 

ronterihwayénhstha' raotityóhkwa  - student group

ronnonkwehón:we ronterihwayénhstha' raotityóhkwa - indiginous student group
sha'katóhetste   - when I passed by

Wakatorihakie   -  I was driving by

shon takatohetste  - ???

 

wa’katorien  - I drove by

You are the best teachers(2):

  • Í:se ne tesenniáhse aonhà:a ioiánere tsi ietshirihonnién:ni.
  • I:se ne aonhá:'a ioiánere tsi takwarihonnién:ni

You taught me (2 of you). tekenirihonnyenni 

They teach her (or them).  shakotirihonnién:ni

He teaches her (or them).  shakorihonnién:ni

Eyes    okà:ra

It has nice eyes    tekakahrí:io’s

It has bad eyesight  kakahráksen

It has big eyes  tekakahrowá:nen’s

Tehskahrí:yos    - You have beautiful eyes.

Teyekahrí:yos   - She has beautiful eyes

 

Tehakahrí:yos  -  He has beautiful eyes.

tekenia'kwané:kare/wa'tkenia'kwané:kare'   - I burp

taionhniatanekare  ???
kahshà:kha/wa'kahsà:kha'we'  - I cough

Kani'té:nis/Wa'kani'té:ni'  - I fart.

kani’ténie’s  - I fart once

kani’teiónkwas  - I fart alot
Kanihstiá:ke's/wa'kanihstiá:ke'  - I pee.
Kaní'taiens/wa'kaní'taien'  - I poop.

Tehotson'kánions/wa'tho'tsón'ke (Í:'i pronoun?)

 

wa'tewakí'tsyonke  - I sneezed
sathwahwen'ékstha  - your diaper
O'karahsnéha otsísto

as one sees                  a’ionhtkathóh:se’ke 

to watch over               a’iontennikonhráhren

evenso                          e’thoh’sá:ne

I’m happy to see you    wa’tkwanonhwerá:ton

He will see her.              enhá:ken
